S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K

                                         2520

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 24, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by Sens. JOHNSON, GRISANTI, SEWARD -- read twice and ordered
         printed, and  when  printed  to  be  committed  to  the  Committee  on
         Commerce, Economic Development and Small Business

       AN  ACT  to  amend the economic development law, in relation to creating
         the Empire State baseball trails program

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  economic  development law is amended by adding a new
    2  article 5-F to read as follows:
    3                                 ARTICLE 5-F
    4                    EMPIRE STATE BASEBALL TRAILS PROGRAM
    5  SECTION 181-F. LEGISLATIVE INTENT.
    6          181-G. DEFINITIONS.
    7          181-H. GENERAL FUNCTIONS, POWERS AND DUTIES OF THE COMMISSIONER.
    8    S 181-F. LEGISLATIVE INTENT. THE LEGISLATURE RECOGNIZES  THAT  PROFES-
    9  SIONAL BASEBALL HAS HISTORICALLY PLAYED AN IMPORTANT ROLE IN THE ECONOM-
   10  IC AND CULTURAL LIFE OF THE STATE. THE PUBLIC IS GENERALLY FAMILIAR WITH
   11  THE  TWO  MAJOR LEAGUE TEAMS IN NEW YORK CITY, AS WELL AS WITH THE BASE-
   12  BALL HALL OF FAME IN COOPERSTOWN. THERE IS MUCH  LESS  PUBLIC  AWARENESS
   13  THAT  NEW  YORK  STATE  IS  ALSO THE HOME OF THIRTEEN PROFESSIONAL MINOR
   14  LEAGUE AND INDEPENDENT LEAGUE TEAMS SPREAD THROUGHOUT THE STATE.  GREAT-
   15  ER PUBLIC AWARENESS OF THESE TEAMS AND  THEIR  GAME  SCHEDULES  HAS  THE
   16  POTENTIAL  TO  SIGNIFICANTLY ADD TO THE STATE'S TOURISM TRADE. THE MINOR
   17  LEAGUE AND INDEPENDENT LEAGUE TEAMS ARE SMALL BUSINESSES THEMSELVES, AND
   18  COULD HELP TO DRAW IN-STATE AND OUT-OF-STATE TOURISTS TO  THEIR  RESPEC-
   19  TIVE  AREAS  OF NEW YORK, THEREBY INCREASING HOTEL, RESTAURANT AND OTHER
   20  TOURIST RELATED SMALL BUSINESSES. IT IS, THEREFORE, THE INTENT  OF  THIS
   21  LEGISLATURE  TO HAVE CREATED A PROGRAM WHICH WILL SYSTEMATICALLY PROMOTE
   22  NEW YORK MINOR LEAGUE AND  INDEPENDENT  LEAGUE  BASEBALL  AS  A  TOURIST
   23  ATTRACTION,  BY ESTABLISHING A BASEBALL TRAIL PROGRAM. IT IS THE FURTHER
   24  INTENT OF THE LEGISLATURE THAT THESE TRAILS BE LINKED THEMATICALLY,  AND

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07165-01-1

       S. 2520                             2

    1  BE  CONSTRUED SO AS TO BE EASILY TRAVELED BY TOURISTS AND BASEBALL FANS.
    2  THE LEGISLATURE SEEKS THE CREATION OF ITINERARIES TO AID TRAVELERS ALONG
    3  BASEBALL TRAILS, WHICH ALSO LINK TOGETHER OTHER ATTRACTIONS  AND  VENUES
    4  ALONG  SAID  TRAILS IN ORDER TO ATTRACT VISITORS WITH A SIMPLE AND EFFI-
    5  CIENT TRAVEL PLAN. FURTHER IT IS THE INTENT OF THIS LEGISLATURE  TO  SEE
    6  THAT  THESE TRAILS ARE ADEQUATELY SIGNED SO THAT TRAVELERS MAY INDEPEND-
    7  ENTLY FOLLOW THE TRAIL WITH EASE.
    8    S 181-G. DEFINITIONS. AS USED IN  THIS  ARTICLE  THE  FOLLOWING  DEFI-
    9  NITIONS SHALL APPLY:
   10    1.  "BASEBALL  TRAIL"  SHALL  MEAN  A  SERIES OF PROFESSIONAL BASEBALL
   11  VENUES IDENTIFIED BY THE COMMISSIONER, WHICH MAY BE LINKED BY GEOGRAPHIC
   12  PROXIMITY AND ALIGNMENT, AND GAME SCHEDULES.
   13    2. "BASEBALL PASSPORT" SHALL MEAN  A  BOOKLET  OR  OTHER  PUBLICATION,
   14  WHICH  IS  SPECIFIC  TO  THE  PROFESSIONAL  BASEBALL VENUES AND GAMES OR
   15  SURROUNDING ATTRACTIONS ON A BASEBALL TRAIL, AND MAY  INCLUDE  DISCOUNTS
   16  AND  OTHER  INCENTIVES  RELATED TO ATTENDING BASEBALL GAMES AND VISITING
   17  THE BASEBALL VENUES AND ATTRACTIONS ON THE BASEBALL TRAIL.
   18    S 181-H. GENERAL FUNCTIONS, POWERS AND DUTIES OF THE COMMISSIONER.  1.
   19  THE  COMMISSIONER  SHALL  DEVELOP  AND IMPLEMENT AN "I LOVE NY BASEBALL"
   20  PROMOTION PROGRAM. THE COMMISSIONER, IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE COMMISSION-
   21  ER OF PARKS, RECREATION AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION AND ANY LOCAL  GOVERN-
   22  MENT  OFFICIAL OR ENTITY, SHALL IDENTIFY A SERIES OF BASEBALL VENUES AND
   23  GAMES TO BE PART OF A BASEBALL TRAIL. NO FEWER THAN TWO BASEBALL  TRAILS
   24  SHOULD  BE  IDENTIFIED  FOR  THE PURPOSES OF THE PROGRAM. IN IDENTIFYING
   25  SPECIFIC VENUES AND GAMES TO BE INCLUDED ON A  BASEBALL  TRAIL,  SPECIAL
   26  CONSIDERATION  SHALL BE GIVEN TO THOSE TRAILS WHICH PROMOTE MINOR LEAGUE
   27  AND INDEPENDENT LEAGUE BASEBALL. SPECIAL  CONSIDERATION  SHALL  ALSO  BE
   28  GIVEN  TO  TRAILS  WHICH  CAN  BE  LINKED TO SURROUNDING ARTS, CULTURAL,
   29  HISTORICAL, ENTERTAINMENT OR OTHER TOURISM DESTINATIONS OR  EXHIBITS  OF
   30  INTEREST TO TRAVELERS.
   31    2.  THE  COMMISSIONER  SHALL  CAUSE  TO BE DEVELOPED BASEBALL VACATION
   32  ITINERARIES BASED ON SPECIFIC BASEBALL TRAILS, WHICH SHALL IDENTIFY  FOR
   33  VISITORS  BASEBALL GAMES AND SURROUNDING ATTRACTIONS, RESTAURANTS, LODG-
   34  ING AND OTHER EXHIBITS OR PLACES OF ENTERTAINMENT AS MAY BE  A  PART  OF
   35  THE THEME LINKING THE BASEBALL VENUES ON THE BASEBALL TRAIL.
   36    3.  THE  COMMISSIONER SHALL WORK TO DEVELOP DISCOUNT PACKAGES FOR SUCH
   37  BASEBALL TRAILS, WHICH MAY INCLUDE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A  BASEBALL  PASS-
   38  PORT.
   39    4.  NOTHING  SHALL  PRECLUDE THE COMMISSIONER FROM CONTRACTING WITH AN
   40  INDEPENDENT VACATION OR TRAVEL PACKAGE COMPANY TO HELP DEVELOP  BASEBALL
   41  VACATION PACKAGES ALONG A BASEBALL TRAIL.
   42    S  2.  This  act shall take effect on the ninetieth day after it shall
   43  have become a law.
